title: Fixes derived from code review of cc_execute & websocket_handler integration (018)

tasks.description: Implement retry logic for transient WebSocket or subprocess failures in websocket_handler._handle_execute and execute_task_via_websocket, using exponential backoff (max 3 attempts)
Add rate-limit handling for Claude API calls in cc_execute_utils.execute_task_via_websocket: detect 429 responses and wait/retry respecting Retry-After header
Make execution timeout configurable in core/config.py and allow override via CLI flag and cc_execute_utils parameter
Evaluate connection pooling: prototype reusable ProcessManager/WebSocket session to reduce subprocess overhead for high task volumes
Clean up or suppress import-related runtime warnings when executing modules directly by refining __main__ guards or logging filters
Introduce structured error types (e.g., TimeoutError, RateLimitError) in models.py and propagate them through JSON-RPC responses
Add integration test covering cc_execute_utils â†’ websocket_handler full flow with mocked Claude subprocess to ensure end-to-end reliability
Document default tool selection strategy and add sensible fallbacks in cc_execute_utils when no tools list provided
